item.title: I Built a CGM Data Reader Dashboard
My First 'Optimal' Portfolio
item.description:
My first encounter with quantitative portfolio optimization came during my undergraduate studies. Inspired by Meucci’s Risk and Asset Allocation as well as Diamond and Boyd’s Stanford teaching I set out to build my first “optimal” portfolio.

With a healthy dose of home bias, I developed what would eventually be published as A Python integration of practical asset allocation based on modern portfolio theory and its advancements

Looking back, the project feels embarrassingly naiveâ€”and surprisingly foundational. While it earned some recognition at the time, it now serves as a valuable reminder: sometimes the best foundation is built before you know enough to doubt yourself.
